pullRequest.body:
The bot is triggered when writes "bot fix style" on a PR, either in an ordinary comment, a review comment, or a review. It then checks if the author has "write" privileges (or above) and if so, will react with a üöÄ emoji on the triggering comment and then lint and push a commit to the PR branch.

Note that this uses the NIGHTLY_TESTING secret.

See [Zulip](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/287929-mathlib4/topic/reviewdog/near/460017984).

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

- [ ] depends on: #15051

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)


This can be tested in [my fork of mathlib4](https://github.com/bryangingechen/mathlib4). The main things left to test are permissions and other edge cases. So feel free to open weird issues / PRs to my fork and comment on them to try and break things. I think only people with write access should be able to trigger the bot now, so if you want write access to my fork let me know here or on Zulip!

For starters, if someone would like to try commenting `bot fix style` on https://github.com/bryangingechen/mathlib4/pull/2 (also in a PR review / PR review comment) I can check if the permissions check is working properly. (Since no one other than me has write access at this time, hopefully the bot will ignore your comment.)

nodes.body:
### PR summary [76accb4619](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/15781/commits/76accb4619924babbbdaec2ed15c0bc0cf61e52c)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

#### Declarations diff

No declarations were harmed in the making of this PR! üêô
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

Let's make sure nothing explodes if I do this:

bot fix style
Ah, it makes sense that the workflow that triggers on comments won't run from a PR.

> Ah, it makes sense that the workflow that triggers on comments won't run from a PR.

You may still be able to test this by modifying a workflow that reacts to comments that already is in master.

As far as I can tell, if the workflow file is in master, then PRs modifying it work with the *modified* script.  So you could override the `maintainter merge` script to perform what you want in a branch and CI *should* act on it.
This will conflict with #15051, so I'll work on this more after that one is merged.

This PR/issue depends on:
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#15051~~
By **[Dependent Issues](https://github.com/z0al/dependent-issues)** (ü§ñ). Happy coding!
<!-- By Dependent Issues (Action) - DO NOT REMOVE -->
bot fix style

Hmm, unfortunately the trick of overwriting the maintainer merge workflow didn't work. The run for the "bot fix style" comment above shows that the workflow on `master` was used: https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10460233262/workflow

This can be tested in [my fork of mathlib4](https://github.com/bryangingechen/mathlib4). The main things left to test are permissions and other edge cases. So feel free to open weird issues / PRs to my fork and comment on them to try and break things. I think only people with write access should be able to trigger the bot now, so if you want write access to my fork let me know here or on Zulip!

For starters, if someone would like to try commenting `bot fix style` on https://github.com/bryangingechen/mathlib4/pull/2  I can check if the permissions check is working properly. (Since no one other than me has write access at this time, hopefully the bot will ignore your comment.)

~~**edit** (2024/08/23): found some bugs, working on fixing them now.~~

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10584359073/job/29328436228)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10584359073/job/29328436490)

Thanks :tada:

bors merge

Thanks :tada:

bors merge
Could you please also make it run `./scripts/lint-bib.sh` and `lake exe mk_all`?
@grunweg Before I rebased this PR on #15051, reviewdog complained about the lack of a space here, so maybe one of the linters was lost in the transition?

Let me investigate: if I remove this space on master and run `lake exe lint-style` or `lake exe lint-style --fix` locally, I rightfully get an error: `Mathlib/Algebra/Quandle.lean : line 155 : ERR_ARR : Missing space after '‚Üê'.`
Thanks looks alright to me. Sorry.

Looks like the error popped up in the run on the latest commit here too, but reviewdog didn't pick it up: https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10415147022/job/28845191206?pr=15781#step:6:38

Since reviewdog just looks at git diff, maybe the fix option isn't writing the change to disk? (Haven't checked locally, sorry!)
Let me check - it should do so (as the writing happens in lint-style.py, which is called just the same).
reminder to self: this needs to be fixed (in another PR) in the maintainer merge workflows as well
Addressed in #16241

Is there a way to add a reaction to a PR review via the API? I tried the following and it gave me a 404 (I'm pretty sure the token I used has the permissions necessary): https://github.com/bryangingechen/mathlib4/actions/runs/10534530644/job/29192315609#step:4:14

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: run style linters in fix mode and push a commit when "bot fix style" is posted in a PR comment

source.title: test style linters / reviewdog in a clean branch
